DOCNAME: CASE OF ÜNSAL ÖZTÜRK v. TURKEY (No. 2)
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is the owner of “ ORG and Publishing ” , a small independent firm that has published numerous books in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE a number of books published by the applicant 's company were found to contain propaganda in breach of various provisions of LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) , as well as “ insults to the memory of NORP ” in breach of PERSON no . DATE . He was convicted and served a total period of DATE , DATE and DATE in prison and paid the equivalent of MONEY ( ORG ) in fines . Most of the books in question were confiscated . On DATE he introduced an application with the ORG in relation to that conviction and the confiscation of the books . On DATE the ORG found a violation of Articles DATE ( see PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Following the repeal of LAW CARDINAL of the Prevention of Terrorism Act in DATE , the applicant made applications to ORG of ORG on various dates in DATE and asked for the confiscation orders to be lifted .
CARDINAL . The First Chamber of ORG rejected the claims and the applicant lodged objections against those rejections with ORG same court .

CARDINAL . The Second Chamber of ORG lifted the confiscation orders in respect of a number of the books but held that , as the confiscation orders had already been executed , there were no books to return .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG held in respect of QUANTITY books that , although section CARDINAL of the Prevention of Terrorism Act had been repealed , the contents of those books amounted not only to “ separatist propaganda ” but were also unlawful “ under various laws ” , and rejected the objection .

CARDINAL . On DATE a further decision was adopted by ORG in respect of the same QUANTITY books . Having regard “ to the legislation in force ” and “ considering that the contents of the books might be in contravention of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ” it refused the applicant 's request for the lifting of the confiscation order in respect of the CARDINAL books .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant appealed against the decision of CARDINAL DATE . The prosecutor at ORG also requested that the decision be quashed because he considered that rejecting the applicant 's request on account of the assumption that the contents of the books “ might be unlawful ” , rather than examining the substance of the applicant 's request in the light of the legal developments , was not in accordance with the law and procedure .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal lodged by the applicant .
